full_summary:
### ITT - Meteghan - Maintenance Dredging and Disposal at Sea
#### AO - Meteghan - Dragage d'entretien et immersion des déblais en mer
#### Reference: WS3959375244-Doc3999547631

On behalf of the Department of Fisheries and Oceans - Small Craft Harbours (DFO-SCH), Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) is seeking a contractor to perform maintenance dredging and disposal at sea at Meteghan Small Craft Harbour in Nova Scotia.

#### Key Information

##### Location
Meteghan, Nova Scotia

##### Estimated Cost
Between $1,000,001 to $5,000,000

##### Submission Period
The contract will be awarded on a competitive basis to the lowest priced bidder.

##### Verification of Bidders' Qualifications
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans - Small Craft Harbours has identified firms who may be pre-qualified for this solicitation and invited to bid. Before submitting a bid, it is recommended that bidders conduct a site visit to familiarize themselves with the harbour and its requirements.

#### Notice Details

##### Solicitation No.
WS3959375244

##### Tender Closing Date
2023-06-08T14:00:00 (Eastern Standard Time)

##### Site Visit
No site visit has been scheduled by the Contracting Authority.

#### Contact Information

- **Contact Person:** Rachel Miller (elle-la / she-her)
- **Email:** rachel.miller@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
- **Language of Communication:** English
- **Bid Submission:** Only to be submitted via SAP Ariba
- **Review of Inquiry Procedure:** Answers to inquiries must be received at least five (5) calendar days prior to the closing date

#### Selection Process

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans – Small Craft Harbours, on behalf of the Contractor-Client, will review all bids and select the successful bid based on the lowest price.

#### Solicitation Reference
WS3959375244-Doc3999547631

#### Enquiries
All inquiries should be directed to the Contracting Authority using the Messages function in SAP Ariba. The tentative deadline for submission of all inquiries is five (5) calendar days prior to the closing date.

#### Language of Documentation
Both official languages of Canada (English and French) have equal status. All information, communications, awards, order, contracts, reporting documents including the solicitation, will be in
